ccre.saver

Class StorageSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.saver.StorageSegment

  • public abstract class StorageSegment
extends java.lang.Object
    A storage segment - a place to store various pieces of data. A StorageSegment can be obtained using StorageProvider.
    Author:
    skeggsc
    See Also:
    StorageProvider

    • Method Detail

      • getStringForKey

        public abstract java.lang.String getStringForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Get a String value for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to look up.
        Returns:
        the String contained there, or null if the key doesn't exist.

      • setStringForKey

        public abstract void setStringForKey(java.lang.String key,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Set the string value behind the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to put the String under.
        value - the String to store under this key.

      • flush

        public abstract void flush()
        Flush the segment. This attempts to make sure that all data is stored on disk (or somewhere else, depending on the provider). If this is not called, data might not be saved!

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        Close the segment. This includes flushing the segment if applicable. The segment may be unusable once this is called. Do not use the segment afterwards.

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this segment, if available.
        Returns:
        the segment's name, or null if none exists.

      • attachStringHolder

        public void attachStringHolder(java.lang.String name,
                      StringHolder holder)
        Attach a StringHolder to this storage segment. This will restore data if it has been stored as modified in the segment. This will save the data of the string holder as it updates, although you may need to call flush() to ensure that the data is saved. This will only overwrite the current value of the StringHolder if the data was saved when the StringHolder had the same default (value when this method is called). This means that you can modify the contents using either the StorageSegment or by changing the StringHolder's original value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to save the holder under.
        holder - the holder to save.

      • attachFloatHolder

        public void attachFloatHolder(java.lang.String name,
                     FloatStatus holder)
        Attach a FloatHolder to this storage segment. This will restore data if it has been stored as modified in the segment. This will save the data of the float holder as it updates, although you will need to call flush() to ensure that the data is saved. This will only overwrite the current value of the FloatHolder if the data was saved when the FloatHolder had the same default (value when this method is called). This means that you can modify the contents using either the StorageSegment or by changing the FloatHolder's original value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to save the holder under.
        holder - the holder to save.

      • attachBooleanHolder

        public void attachBooleanHolder(java.lang.String name,
                       BooleanStatus holder)
        Attach a BooleanHolder to this storage segment. This will restore data if it has been stored as modified in the segment. This will save the data of the boolean holder as it updates, although you will need to call flush() to ensure that the data is saved. This will only overwrite the current value of the BooleanHolder if the data was saved when the BooleanHolder had the same default (value when this method is called). This means that you can modify the contents using either the StorageSegment or by changing the BooleanHolder's original value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to save the holder under.
        holder - the holder to save.
